Package DSA.Graphs.MatrixGraph

Class AdjacencyVect

java.lang.Object
DSA.Graphs.MatrixGraph.AdjacencyVect
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Integer>, Collection<Integer>
public class AdjacencyVect extends Object implements Collection<Integer>
AdjacencyVect is a collection that represents a vector-based adjacency list for a graph. It allows for efficient storage and retrieval of vertices in a graph using an array of boolean values. This class implements the Collection interface, providing methods to add, remove, and check for the presence of vertices, as well as to iterate over the vertices in the graph.

  • Constructor Details

    • AdjacencyVect

      public AdjacencyVect(int size)
      Constructs an AdjacencyVect with a specified size. The size determines the number of vertices that can be represented in the graph.
      Parameters:
      size - the number of vertices in the graph

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add(Integer e)
      Returns the size of the adjacency vector. This is the number of vertices that can be represented in the graph.
      Specified by:
      add in interface Collection<Integer>
      Returns:
      the size of the adjacency vector

    • addAll

      public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends Integer> c)
      Adds all elements from the specified collection to the adjacency vector. If an element is already present, it will not be added again.
      Specified by:
      addAll in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      c - the collection of elements to add
      Returns:
      true if any elements were added, false otherwise

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the adjacency vector, effectively clearing the graph. This method sets all values in the vector to false and resets the element count. Complexity: O(n), where n is the size of the vector.
      Specified by:
      clear in interface Collection<Integer>

    • containsAll

      public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c)
      Checks if the adjacency vector contains a specific element. This method checks if the given index is valid and if the corresponding value in the vector is true. Complexity: O(1), as it directly accesses the index in the vector.
      Specified by:
      containsAll in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      c - the element to check for presence
      Returns:
      true if the element is present, false otherwise

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the adjacency vector is empty. This method returns true if no vertices are present in the graph. Complexity: O(n), where n is the size of the vector, as it checks each element in the vector.
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface Collection<Integer>
      Returns:
      true if the adjacency vector is empty, false otherwise

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Integer> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the elements in the adjacency vector. The iterator will only return indices of vertices that are present in the graph. Complexity: O(n), where n is the size of the vector, as it may need to iterate through all elements to find the next one.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Collection<Integer>
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Integer>
      Returns:
      an iterator over the indices of present vertices

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Object o)
      Removes a specific element from the adjacency vector. This method sets the corresponding index in the vector to false and decrements the element count if the element was present. Complexity: O(1), as it directly accesses the index in the vector.
      Specified by:
      remove in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      o - the element to remove
      Returns:
      true if the element was removed, false otherwise

    • removeAll

      public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c)
      Removes all elements in the specified collection from the adjacency vector. This method iterates through the collection and removes each element if it is present. Complexity: O(m * n), where m is the size of the collection and n is the size of the vector.
      Specified by:
      removeAll in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      c - the collection of elements to remove
      Returns:
      true if any elements were removed, false otherwise

    • retainAll

      public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c)
      Retains only the elements in the adjacency vector that are also contained in the specified collection. This method removes all elements that are not present in the collection. Complexity: O(n * m), where n is the size of the vector and m is the size of the collection.
      Specified by:
      retainAll in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      c - the collection of elements to retain
      Returns:
      true if any elements were removed, false otherwise

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements currently present in the adjacency vector. This is the count of vertices that have been added to the graph. Complexity: O(1), as it simply returns the elementCount variable.
      Specified by:
      size in interface Collection<Integer>
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the adjacency vector

    • toArray

      public Object[] toArray()
      Converts the adjacency vector to an array of Integer objects. The array will contain the indices of all vertices that are present in the graph. Complexity: O(n), where n is the size of the vector, as it may need to iterate through all elements to find the next one.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface Collection<Integer>
      Returns:
      an array containing the indices of present vertices

    • toArray

      public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a)
      Converts the adjacency vector to an array of the specified type. The array will contain the indices of all vertices that are present in the graph. Complexity: O(n), where n is the size of the vector, as it may need to iterate through all elements to find the next one.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface Collection<Integer>
      Parameters:
      a - the array to store the elements
      Returns:
      an array containing the indices of present vertices, possibly of a different type
